title: A Royal Family Christmas Photo
summary: Prince William and Princess Catherine have shared a new family photo for their Christmas card in 2025. The picture shows them sitting on grass with their three children: George, Charlotte, and Louis. It was taken by a photographer named Josh Shinner in Norfolk during spring. The family looks happy and close together. They posted the photo online with a message wishing everyone a Happy Christmas. This photo is part of Catherine's return to public life after she had cancer treatment. The family will spend Christmas with King Charles and other royals at Sandringham. Last year, they used a photo from when Catherine finished her chemotherapy for their card. This year's card shows a relaxed and informal side of the royal family.

background_read: The royal family, including Prince William and Princess Catherine, often shares photos for special occasions like Christmas. Catherine has been recovering from cancer, which means she was sick but is getting better. Christmas cards are a tradition where people send pictures and greetings to friends and family. Norfolk is a county in England with royal homes. The photo shows the family in a casual and happy way, which is different from more formal royal pictures.
Article_Structure: WHO: Prince William, Princess Catherine, and their children George, Charlotte, and Louis
WHAT: They released a family photo for their 2025 Christmas card
WHERE: The photo was taken in Norfolk, and they will spend Christmas at Sandringham
WHY: To share holiday greetings and show Catherine's return to public life after cancer treatment

perspectives.description: The photo emphasizes the closeness and happiness of the royal family during the holidays.
